text: Yun Chi-Young (Hangul: 윤치영, February 10 1898 - February 9 1996) was a Korean Independent Activist and politician, educators, diplomats. His nickname was 'DongSan' (동산, 東山). 1st Interior Minister (1948) of South Korea, 1st, 2nd and 3rd the National Assembly of South Korean. Younger Half-Uncle was Yun Bo-seon, 4th president of South Korea. 2nd Republic of Korea Ambassador to French 1950 to 1951, 13th Mayor of Seoul City at December 17, 1963 to March 30, 1966. == Book == * 『Yun Chi-young's 20c』(윤치영의 20세기) ==Related pages== * Yun Posun * Rhee Syngman * Yun Chi-ho * Park Chung-hee * Chang Myon * Kim Gu == References == * http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=520742 Category:1898 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Korean educators Category:Korean people Category:Anti-communists Category:South Korean politicians Category:Korean writers
title: Yun Chi-young
